result.execSummary:
The defendant Randarius L Keys was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Randarius L Keys

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Case called at 10:35 AM 
Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Randarius L Keys in court with attorney J Andrew Herbers. 
Court conducts plea colloquy with the defendant.
Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to Count 1.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of Count 1.
State makes sentencing recommendations.
Defense makes sentencing recommendations.

COUNT 1
Court orders the following:
Fine:  $379.00
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $200.00
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid in 90-days.
Penalty:  Entry of a Civil Judgment

Current: 227 Hinman Ave, Apt 3, Waukesha, WI 53186 United States  (Effective: 05-03-2022)
Prior: PO Box 05911, c/o Milwaukee Secure Detention Facility, Milwaukee, WI 53205-0911 United States  
**updated per Atty. Herbers (mjs)
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 19, 2022 at 10:30 am.

dated 05-03-2022 from Atty. J. Andrew Hertbers, requesting a plea and sentencing date.  
**reviewed by the court on 05-03-2022:  granted - hearing on 05-19-2022 to be converted to Plea and Sentencing.
by fax from MSDF
Faxed Amended Bail/Bond forms to Milwaukee Secure Detention Facility, with confirmation of successful fax transmission

Hearing on May 19, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Hearing on May 24, 2022 at 08:15 am.

CONDITIONS:
Defendant may have contact with Victim A.
Defendant is not to discuss with Victim A regarding this case while it is pending.
Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.
Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.
Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.
Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.
Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms.

Case called at 10:09 AM 
District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Randarius L Keys in court, in custody at MSDF by zoom, with attorney J Andrew Herbers by phone.
Victim appeared in court in person.
All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.
Attorney Herbers rquests that the No Contact provision be lifted or be modified to No Violent Contact.
Victim makes statements.  State objects.
Court will Modify the Conditions of Bail  to allow contact with Victim A.  Defendant is not allowed to discuss the case with Victim A.
Attorney Herbers requests that the case 22CM0030 be placed on the trial calendar.
Case to tag along.  Hearing scheduled for May 19, 2022 at 10:30 am.  Hearing scheduled for May 24, 2022 at 08:15 am.
